title: Median Cost for Boarding Duke: Stemplot
question_text:
Daisy is planning a vacation and will need to board her pet dog Duke while she is away. After gathering data from all of kennels in her area, she produced the stemplot below to display the distribution of costs for boarding Duke for one night.

What is the median price of boarding Duke for one night?
solution:
The median is the middle value (or average of the two middle values) when the observations are arranged in order.

By counting values shown in the stemplot, we can determine that there were
32
observations. The median then, would be the average of the
16
th
and
17
th
highest values.

To find these values, start from the bottom of the stemplot and work your way upward. Remember to always start from the left value in a row since the values are arranged in rows from lowest value to highest value.

The middle two values are highlighted in the stemplot below. Since both of these values correspond with a cost of
$
26
, the median is
$
26
.

Choice 'C' is the correct answer.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect. You may arrive at this answer if you start counting at the top of the stemplot and move downward while also counting from left to right along a row. If you are counting from the top down, you must move from right to left along the rows since this will keep the values in order from highest to lowest.

Choice 'B' is incorrect. While
$
24.00
is one of the most common values (one of the modes), and visually appears to be near the middle of the distribution, it is not the median.

Choice 'D' is incorrect. You may arrive at this answer through simple errors in miscounting!

Choice 'E' is incorrect because it represents the mean of the distribution.
